title: Did Riot REALLY need to call him "Rek'Sai" .... The trolls, incoming.

embed.description: The shifting Shuriman sands harbor countless tales, and while most speak of its long-forgotten civilization, others reveal something else: terror within the dunes. The nomads and traders that cross through Runeterra's golden lands know the stories well enough, the bloody remains of their kin a testament to the void beast below.

body:
So you name him Rek'Sai

"Get Rek'd" is all I can see incoming...

Riot could you please think first... It's bad enough people saying "Dunked" all the time as darius.

Cool looking champ though... But there seriously are too many childish idiots going to play on this name... I can just see it now.

Opened up ANOTHER can of worms.

replies.body: Saying "rekt" or even "rek'd" is not trolling. Do you even know what trolling is?

Are you going to get technical here or are we going to use the term trolling as the definition of someone being an ass on the internet? I'm using it as the one more commonly used. It's like defining the word gay by saying it means happy.

I feel some trolling to precedes this message.

Anywahoo, this whole post proves my point with PhantomiZer showing the sheer maturity of the community. =D
The whole "get Rek'd" deal is only a play on words, lighten up a bit chum.{{item:2009}}
By making this thread you have just contributed to making more people thinking of this idea and maybe posting "get rek'd mate"!
I'm keen on picking someone on the enemy and 100% focusing them down every team fight no matter what then dropping the "get tunneled" in all chat every time I kill em 8)
It just really feels like Riot are trolling us atm.
I dont see how this is a problem, let people have their fun and so what if they nickname it.
I prefer to refer to her as "Skarneesha"
